choices.name: Get started with research for your Illinois ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for Illinois ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine priorities for Illinois research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Illinois research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Illinois Research Tips and Strategies
    ☆ AR—Places to Discover Your Illinois Ancestors

  2. Follow this research study for Illinois ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Illinois Research, 1880-Present

  3. Get an overview of Illinois research in these videos.

    ☆ FS—Illinois Overview—3:10
    AAC—Researching in the Prairie State—Video series (account required)

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for Illinois research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Illinois Resources
    ☆ AC—Illinois State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  5. Record Finder: Use the Illinois Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Illinois Record Selection Table

    6. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Additional Records

1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Ethnic

1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Illinois in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Illinois
    ☆ FS—Wiki: Illinois Minorities

  2. Learn about African American records in this article.

    ☆ AG—Illinois African American Records

  3. Explore the African American Gateway for Illinois.
  4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Illinois in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Illinois

1. Explore Illinois historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Illinois History

  2. Explore Illinois history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Illinois

  3. Learn about Illinois history on InfoPlease.com.

    ☆ Illinois History

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Illinois archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about Illinois archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Illinois archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Illinois Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Illinois State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research
  2. Learn about using Illinois repositories for research.

    ☆ AAC—Illinois Repositories—6:58

  3. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Illinois.
  4. Explore the Illinois State Archives collection, including the Physicians database.
  5. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Illinois.
  6. Explore the State Illinois Digital Archives site for historical documents and images.
  7. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Illinois genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  8. Search for ☆free online books on Illinois research on the FamilySearch site.
  9. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find Illinois ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Illinois city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Illinois Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Illinois city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Illinois city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Illinois ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Illinois city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
QUIKLinks

name: Vital and Census Records
section_name: Learn about Illinois vital and census records.

hidden.summary:

  4. Explore Illinois birth, marriage, and death records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site.
  5. Explore additional links for Illinois vital records on the ☆Linkpendium site.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Illinois research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Illinois County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Illinois.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Illinois Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Illinois research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the Illinois Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Illinois Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the U.S. Midwest Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  4. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Illinois.
  5. Explore Illinois research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Illinois research.
  2. Explore the Illinois research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Illinois research.

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Illinois in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Illinois Societies

  2. Explore the Illinois State Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore the Chicago Genealogical Society site.
  4. Explore Illinois genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  5. Get help at a family history center in Illinois.
Regional/Local Societies
